primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God breaks open the old world to create a space of freedom and recruits human agents to occupy and enact this freedom through transformative service.

tekstueel_bewijs: God’s agents (Elijah, Jesus) recruit folk to walk with them
It is human agents who sign on for the new freedom
new life and joy and transformative power
the inexplicable capacity to overcome the disorder of the world

zender.identificatie: The God of the Gospel / YHWH
tekstueel_bewijs: the God of the Gospel has broken the tired old world open
enhance the neighborhood and to bring joy and well-being to the neighbor

helper.identificatie: The Spirit / Memories of the Exodus
tekstueel_bewijs: He receives a double portion of the spirit
What she remembers is the Exodus
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender who provides the 'space', but the human is the Subject who must 'occupy' it.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help for the human subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: held back by old loves, by old loyalties, by old commitments, by old fears
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as internal hesitation and nostalgia rather than an ontological or cosmic bondage that requires a Savior.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from self-preoccupation (narcissism) to remembering God's deeds.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Psalmist / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program of 'remembering' is the modal competence (Savoir) needed for the primary program of 'following'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has broken the tired old world open
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Elisha takes on a new vocation
The disciples returned from their mission
We walk up to God’s new freedom

voorbeelden: The new obedience is to act
I want to think with you
The invitation to follow is overwhelming
You need to know what you are signing on for
I will call to mind the deeds
the inexplicable capacity to overcome the disorder
set free to raise the dead

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on shifting the hearer's will from 'held back' to 'yielding' to the invitation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Old World) to ~S2 (God breaks it open), then lingers in ~S1 (the recruits are held back), finally urging a leap to S1 (Freedom).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'overwhelming persistence' of the invitation which eventually causes the subject to yield.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; S2 is seen as 'tired' and 'business as usual' rather than 'Death' or 'Condemnation'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses theocentric language ('God breaks the world open'), the actantial engine is anthropocentric: God creates the 'space,' but the human must 'sign on' and 'occupy' it. It is a narrative of recruitment and empowerment rather than substitutionary rescue.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It is God who breaks the world open; it is human agents who sign on for the new freedom.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The invitation to follow is overwhelming and persistent... in spite of ourselves.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Elisha and the Disciples are used as models of successful 'yielding' and 'occupying' the new space.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God's faithfulness sustained the disciples despite their failure, rather than their 'inexplicable capacity' once they signed on.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration mixed with pressure to 'not look back' and to 'occupy' the freedom.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is framed as the human subject's performance within a God-given arena.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Very high; the 'held back vs. moving forward' motif is consistently applied across all biblical texts.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God-given freedom' and the human 'will to dare great things'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The setup is a dramatic opening of new possibility and an invitation to embrace the new possibility with a differently lived life.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is a 'portion' or 'power' that enables the human subject to perform miracles/service.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'narcissism' or 'old loyalties'—impediments to progress rather than a fatal condition.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon correctly identifies God as the 'Sender' of freedom but shifts the 'Subject' role to the human recruit too quickly. The hearer is pressured to be the hero of the 'following' narrative.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human is the subject of 'occupying,' 'signing on,' and 'transforming.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who follows the Father's will perfectly on our behalf, and who 'carries' us into freedom.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'human agents sign on,' use 'Christ signs our names in heaven and draws us after Him.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Recruit' who must perform.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'names written in heaven' as a gift received rather than a reward for 'not looking back.'

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Pouvoir (God's power doing what we cannot)
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on 'in spite of ourselves' as the primary engine of the story.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Portray the 'old world' as a tomb that only a resurrection (not just an invitation) can solve.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Stronger grace requires a stronger sense of bondage.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (Secondary Program) is fused with Soteriology (Primary Program).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Clearly distinguish that we are 'fit for the kingdom' because of Christ (Program 1) before we 'plow' (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and uses beautiful imagery, but it risks burdening the hearer by making 'freedom' a task to be achieved rather than a gift to be inhabited.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is inviting; semiotically, it is a recruitment contract.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis focuses on the 'plow' as a warning; Greimas shows the 'plow' is the Object the Subject must master.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'God' is largely the 'Stage-setter' while the 'Human' is the 'Actor'.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon's use of 'in spite of ourselves' is the only thing preventing it from being pure moralism.
